physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 3 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#460 JCRS Staff''. On back of print ''Dr. Alan Rest Medical Director and Superintendent - JCRS, 1944, #460 JCRS.''

mods.abstract: Dr. Arthur Rest, Medical Director and Superintendent of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
